title: Kenya faces calls for religious regulation after Shakahola cult massacre
description: President William Ruto, who is himself a 'born again' Christian and has benefited politically from the support of evangelicals, has announced the creation of a commission to consider reform of the law on religious institutions.

title: Emmanuel Macron urges for 'pause' in EU environment regulations
description: Macron, while unveiling his French 'reindustrialization' plan, argued that the EU had done 'more than all the neighbors' and that it now 'needed stability'.

title: US judge says anyone over the age of 18 has the right to buy handguns
description: Americans under the age of 21 cannot currently purchase a handgun from a federally licensed dealer. The US District Court judge cited a recent Supreme Court decision that expanded the rights of gun owners in his opinion on Wednesday.

title: Europa League: Roma narrowly defeats Leverkusen while Juventus draw against Sevilla
description: Youth product Edoardo Bove scored the game-winning goal for Roma while Federico Gatti headed home in the 97th minute to earn Juventus a 1-1 draw against Sevilla.

title: Elon Musk announces he has hired an unnamed woman to be Twitter's next CEO
description: Elon Musk said Thursday he has found a new CEO for Twitter. He did not name her but said she will be starting in about six weeks.

title: Violence in Israel and Gaza intensifies on third day of tensions
description: Cairo mediated in efforts toward a truce between Israel and the Islamic Jihad militant group, while the European Union called for an immediate ceasefire.

title: France's Sarkozy risks new trial over alleged Libya campaign financing
description: The former French president is accused of corruption, illegal campaign financing and concealing the embezzlement of public funds.

title: Tunisia's ambiguity towards its Jewish community
description: Tuesday's attack on the Ghriba synagogue on the island of Djerba will affect the relationship between Tunisian Jews and their country.

title: Tunisian synagogue attack survivors: 'It could have been a carnage'
description: The motives of the assailant who killed five people during a Jewish pilgrimage on the Tunisian island of Djerba remain unknown.

title: We tested 'The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom', Nintendo's endless story
description: In a direct sequel to 'Breath of the Wild' (2017), 'The Legend of Zelda' video game series delivers the superior and definitive version of its illustrious predecessor with 'Tears of the Kingdom'.

title: Caught in China-US rivalry, South Korea is tempted by military nuclear capacity
description: At the end of April, South Korea and the United States signed the Washington Declaration on nuclear weapons. But Seoul remains concerned about the threat posed by its northern neighbor.

title: Biden administration seeks to stem migration crisis at Mexican border
description: The expiration of Title 42, a provision adopted by the Trump administration to deport asylum seekers without examining their applications, portends a new influx of migrants as early as Thursday.

title: Pakistan's Supreme Court declares Imran Khan's arrest 'invalid', orders his release
description: The former prime minister had been detained on corruption charges, sparking violent protests.

title: UK confirms supply of long-range missiles to Ukraine
description: The Storm Shadow missile, which can be operated in extreme conditions, has been used by British and French forces in the Gulf, Iraq and Libya.

title: Star caught in the act of swallowing a planet
description: Following the observation of a stellar flash, an investigation using California-based ZTF data was able to show that it was a giant planet engulfed by its star.

title: Turkey: Candidate drops out of presidential race, in boost to main Erdogan challenger
description: Muharrem Ince has withdrawn from Turkey's presidential election after being targeted by an online smear campaign in a move that is likely to bolster President Erdogan's main challenger.

title: Italy: Van carrying oxygen tanks explodes in Milan
description: The driver suffered minor injuries in the incident, which took place in the center of the city, forcing the evacuation of a school and residential apartment buildings.

title: Hong Kong newspaper will stop publishing prominent cartoonist's drawings after government complaints
description: Wong Kei-kwan, known as Zunzi, had a 40-year partnership with the newspaper 'Ming Pao.' This move is a further example of media restrictions after a Beijing-led crackdown.

title: French MPs vote to require town halls to fly EU flag
description: The bill drew controversy as a clear challenge to the far right a year ahead of European Parliament elections and a red rag to left-wing lawmakers, who called it a distraction from President Macron's unpopular pension reforms.

title: French mayor resigns after death threats and arson over plans to host refugees
description: Yannick Morez, the mayor of a town in western France, was a regular target of far-right protests. He complained of 'a lack of support from the state' when he stepped down.

title: Despite inflation, French tour operators see upswing in bookings before summer
description: Among possible destinations for summer vacations, southern Europe, the United States and Canada are popular with French tourists.

title: Biden administration announces plan to curb emissions from power plants
description: The US government has announced plans to curb emissions from the nation's power stations, responsible for a quarter of greenhouse gasses produced by the world's largest economy.

title: The 'Les Flammes' awards in Paris celebrate the diversity of rap music
description: France is holding its first awards ceremony for the genre, which considers itself under-represented at other music awards.

title: War in Ukraine: The endless battle for Bakhmut
description: The fight for the city in eastern Ukraine could constitute a turning point for Russia's conquest and for Ukraine's counter-offensive.

title: Italy takes another step toward new nuclear plants
description: A motion requesting the return of nuclear power to Italian territory was approved by the Chamber of Deputies on Tuesday, strengthening Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni's pro-nuclear stance.

title: Le Pen distances herself from ally who marched with neo-fascists
description: The far-right French leader described Axel Loustau as simply 'an accountant,' though he continues to receive money from her party through his communications company.

title: French bank BNP to stop funding new gas projects
description: The move follows repeated criticisms from activists that the banking giant is falling short on climate protection.

title: Armenia and Azerbaijan exchange fire along border
description: The two Caucasus neighbors blamed each other for the violence, which resulted in one death and multiple injuries, just days ahead of EU-hosted peace talks.

title: What's in the French government's bill for digital safety
description: On Wednesday, the French government unveiled its 'digital insecurity' bill. It provides for blocking uncooperative pornographic sites, banning social media access after certain offenses, and blacklisting fraudulent sites.

title: NBA playoffs: Warriors survive against Lakers, Knicks hang on against Heat
description: The Golden State Warriors live to fight another day after beating Los Angeles Lakers in dramatic game. The New York Knicks held off Miami Heat to push their semi-final to a sixth game.

title: Gaza Strip responds to assassinations of Islamic Jihad leaders with salvoes of rockets
description: The rockets, which particularly targeted Tel Aviv, were retaliation for the Israeli army killing three men involved in the religious and nationalist group.

title: Macron tries to turn the page on pensions by returning to the economy
description: The French president intends to highlight the effectiveness of his economic policy with announcements this week about reindustrialization.

title: 'The war in Ukraine has reshuffled the cards in a post-communist Europe where Russia is blowing on nationalist embers'
description: The only country openly opposed to military aid to Ukraine, Viktor Orban's Hungary, could find itself less isolated after elections in Slovakia in September, writes Le Monde columnist Sylvie Kauffmann.

title: EU launches historic joint gas purchase tender to increase energy security
description: A total of 77 European companies, including energy-intensive manufacturers, have decided to participate and intend to purchase 11.6 billion cubic meters.

title: Donald Trump doubles down on election lies and insults sexual assault accuser in CNN town hall
description: The CNN town hall in New Hampshire was the first major television event of the 2024 presidential campaign.

title: The Swedish far right's culture war against drag queens
description: Since last fall, threats against children's shows by drag queens in libraries have increased, raising fears about the freedom of the cultural sector.

title: Paris Saint-Germain's Ultras suspend activities in protest against club management
description: The Collectif Ultras Paris, a grouping of several supporters' associations, announced that they will not go to the Parc des Princes 'until further notice', a day after a meeting with the club's management.

title: France announces comprehensive plan to improve care for injured soldiers
description: The Junior Minister in charge of Veterans Patricia Mirallès, announced plans to create more than 110 initiatives to improve support for wounded soldiers and bereaved families.
